itemLabel: Hilda Runciman, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford

wikipedia_page.main: Hilda Runciman, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford (28 September 1869 – 28 October 1956) was a British Liberal Party politician.

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: ***Hilda Runciman, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford (1869–1956), MP. Spouse of the above.

Hilda Runciman, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford, wife of the first Viscount, represented St Ives in the House of Commons from 1928 to 1929. Also, the Hon. Sir Steven Runciman, younger son of the first Viscount and Hilda, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford, was a noted historian.
* Hilda Runciman, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford (1869–1956), British politician

#Redirect Hilda Runciman, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford
*Hilda Runciman, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford, British Liberal Party politician

Fairweather was born in 1901 in the West Denton part of Newcastle upon Tyne. Her mother, Hilda Runciman, Viscountess Runciman of Doxford and her father Walter Runciman, 1st Viscount Runciman of Doxford were both members of parliament. She was educated at Notting Hill High School for GirlsOxford Dictionary of National Biography
